question:

question:
proofread this:

As I studied it more profoundly, conducting research on the market, analyzing data and reading financial news, I eventually found an explanation. The earlier drop in the stock market from 50 bps priced in the possibility that the Fed was going to rise the rates even further while the 50 bps in December helped traders in Wall Street to priced in the probability that the Fed was going to slow down. Such realization not only fulfill my curiosity towards the effect of policy on financial market but also strengthen my determination to pursue an advanced degree.
Academically, I take a great number of professional courses ranging from social science courses, like Micro/Macroeconomics, Business economics to technical courses, such as Data analytics and Quantitative methods in Finance to create a holistic foundation of my skillset. Soon, I wanted to get involved in something more engaging and practical, as a result, I participated in various academic projects where I was able to apply theoretical models to a practical setting and understand the basic concept more profoundly. In the project of Solow Model of Economic Growth, I prototyped steady state of GDP-per-capita given different scenarios and provided economic justifications to the model output. Specifically, I utilized Solow Model to investigate the short-term and long-term effect on GDP-per-capita when other factors are changing, for example, increase in capital stock. Another project related to Consumption-savings Model promoted my economic intuition to the next level. When I applied Consumption-savings model with log utility to explain the relationships between consumption and savings decision, I provided reasonable explanations for the effect of interest rate increase on consumption and saving decision and offered economic intuition to the effect of different discount factor and the design of the model. Apart from my experience at UCSD, I also got involved in program at UBC. When performing thorough analysis on global economy characteristics and projecting its long-term growth and trend, I analyzed the relationships between international relations and public policy and how they affect global economy. 
My experience is not limited to academics; Beyond school work, I always seized every opportunity that can possibly improve myself as a better candidate. My experience as a Media Operations Intern at Guangzhou Cultural Creativity Industry Association helped to shape my soft skills. When I worked collaboratively with internal team to design and implement various activities, I collected and shared results and feedback from promotional events with supervisor for improved decision-making. Moreover, I was also responsible for maintaining corporate relationship with business partners and leveraging social media platforms to support business‚Äô long-term growth. This internship helped me realized the importance of the collaboration across various teams and also improved my communication and leaderships skills. Later, I worked as an asset management intern at GF Securities where my technical skills were honed. In addition to playing a key role in the IPO process and applying my economic knowledge, I also programed an automatic data process pipeline that covered data collection, cleaning and standardization process for companies‚Äô fundamental data. Because the data from the data vendor was not perfect as my team wished, I designed missing value imputation method with specifical imputing rules to ensure the quality of the data. On the modeling side, I also served as a good quantitative modeler; I researched the fundamentals behind various discounted cash flow models to facilitate arbitrage strategy research and conduced in-depth analysis on the educations field and forecasted cash flows based on technical indicators. This unique experience expends of my horizon in finance and also prepared me to gain a deeper understanding of real-world finance.
Save & SubmitCancel
subject: language_polishing
answer:
Here is my proofread version of your text:
As I delved deeper into the matter, conducting thorough market research, analyzing data, and keeping up with financial news, I finally found an explanation that satisfied my curiosity. The earlier drop in the stock market could be attributed to the market pricing in a potential further increase in rates by the Fed. In contrast, the 50 bps in December led traders on Wall Street to anticipate a slowdown, which was reassuring. This realization not only quenched my intellectual curiosity about the impact of policy on financial markets but also bolstered my ambition to continue my studies in this field.

My academic pursuits have been diverse, encompassing a wide range of professional courses. I have gained a comprehensive understanding of various subjects, including micro and macroeconomics, business economics, data analytics, and quantitative methods in finance. Yearning for a more hands-on and practical learning experience, I actively participated in numerous academic projects. In one such project, I applied the Solow Model of Economic Growth to prototype the steady state of GDP per capita under different scenarios, providing economic justifications for the outcomes. Additionally, by employing the Consumption-savings Model with log utility, I investigated the intricate relationships between consumption and savings decisions, offering insights into the impact of interest rate changes and the role of different discount factors.

My exploration into the realm of economics extended beyond the classroom, as I participated in programs at UBC. While analyzing the global economy's characteristics and projecting its long-term trajectory, I delved into the intricate connections between international relations, public policy, and their influence on the global economic landscape. 

My experience extends beyond the academic realm. As a Media Operations Intern at the Guangzhou Cultural Creativity Industry Association, I enhanced my soft skills and collaborated closely with the internal team. I played a meaningful role in designing and executing various activities and provided valuable feedback to my supervisor, contributing to more informed decision-making. Furthermore, I was responsible for managing relationships with business partners and leveraging social media platforms for the business's long-term growth and visibility. This internship taught me the significance of cross-team collaboration and helped refine my communication and leadership abilities.

I further honed my technical and quantitative skills during my internship in asset management at GF Securities. Besides playing a crucial role in the IPO process and applying my economic expertise, I initiated an automated data processing pipeline for standardizing fundamental data. Recognizing the imperfections in the data obtained from the data vendor, I creatively designed a missing value imputation method to ensure data integrity. Moreover, I delved into quantitative modeling, researching discounted cash flow models for arbitrage strategy research and conducting in-depth analyses of the education sector, enabling accurate cash flow projections based on technical indicators. This experience, enriched my understanding of real-world finance and provided me with insights into the practical application of theoretical concepts.

question:
Following is part of a chapter of my thesis. Can you help me to revise or polish it to make it more readable. I wish you would underline or italicize the make where you make revisions. Thank you. 

2.3.1 Previous Studies on L2 Motivational Self-System
As an important factor affecting learning effectiveness, learners' motivation has received the attention of many researchers, who have explored the nature of motivation from various research perspectives ÔºàWang Xiaomin & Zhang Wenzhong, 2005). Foreign language motivation has gone through four major developmental stages: 1. the psychosocial period (1959-1990); 2. the cognitive context period (1990s); 3. the process-oriented period (2000-2005); and 4. the social dynamic period (now) (Jin Haiyun, 2013). D√∂rnyei's L2MSS theory is the latest achievement in this period. Research at home and abroad on L2 motivational self-system can be divided into confirmatory studies of L2 motivational self-system and correlation studies of L2 motivational self-system with other variables.
2.3.1.1 Confirmatory studies of L2 motivational self-system at home and abroad
The L2MSS has got strong reactions in the academic circles since its introduction. D√∂rnyei and Csizer et al. (2006) conducted a large-scale empirical study in Hungary with more than 13,000 students and concluded that the ideal L2 self and the ought-to L2 self play an important role in language learning. Since this famous study, researchers have conducted a great number of empirical studies in different countries such as Hungary (Csizer & Kormos, 2009), Japan (Ryan, 2009), Iran, and China (Taguchi, Magid & Papi, 2009) to verify the validity and operationalization of L2MSS.
Csizer and Kormos (2009) took a questionnaire to investigate the similarities and differences in the motivation of Hungarian learners at different levels, and also compared the relationship between the ideal L2 self and the ought-to L2 self of the L2MSS and traditional motivation. The study verified the validity of L2MSS in the Hungarian context, and they found that the ideal L2 self, the ought-to L2 self, and the L2 learning experience are independent motivational factors. Ryan (2009) conducted an empirical study of 2397 college and high school English learners from a variety of schools and found that the ideal L2 self was very highly correlated with traditional integrative motivation, but D√∂rnyei's ideal L2 self was more effective than Gardner's integrative motivation in explaining motivated behavior of learners. Taguchi, Magid, and Papi (2009) carried out a large empirical study of nearly 5,000 students from three Asian countries (China, Japan, and Iran), including middle school students, college students majoring in English and non-English, and adult language learners. Through correlation analysis and structural equation modeling, this study also confirmed the validity of the three components of L2MSS and validated the theory in these three Asian countries. In China, Liu, Fengge (2012) found that the ideal L2 self is more relevant to second language motivation than the traditional integrative motivation for Chinese English learners, which is similar with the conclusion of D√∂rnyei and Ryan.
And then she carried out a study to test the validity of the L2MSS in a Chinese language learning context with 956 English learners of five different English levels (Elementary and middle school students, English major undergraduates, non-English major undergraduates, English major postgraduates, non-English major postgraduates) (2015). The results showed that the L2MSS is applicable to investigate the motivation of all kinds of Chinese learners who learn English as a foreign language, and the ideal L2 self is more powerful than the integrative motivation in explaining learners motivation. Since then, there has been a growing body of research on L2MSS in China.
These studies validated D√∂rnyei's "L2MSS" and showed that the theory can be used in different language learning contexts, which also provided insight for the implementation of this study.
subject: language_polishing
answer:
Here's your draft with some minor changes to improve readability:

2.3.1 Previous Studies on L2 Motivational Self-System
 Learner motivation has been a widely studied factor influencing learning effectiveness, progressing through four stages: the psychosocial period, the cognitive context period, the process-oriented period, and the current social dynamic period, with D√∂rnyei's L2 Motivational Self-System (L2MSS) theory being the latest contribution. Research on L2MSS has predominantly focused on two areas: confirmatory studies verifying the model's validity and correlation studies exploring its relationship with other variables.

2.3.1.1 Confirmatory Studies of L2MSS at Home and Abroad
D√∂rnyei's L2MSS theory has elicited substantial interest in academic circles. D√∂rnyei and Csizer et al. (2006) conducted a large-scale study involving over 13,000 students in Hungary, concluding that the ideal L2 self and the ought-to L2 self are significant motivators in language learning. This study has been influential, inspiring numerous empirical investigations worldwide, including in Hungary (Csizer & Kormos, 2009), Japan (Ryan, 2009), Iran, and China (Taguchi, Magid & Papi, 2009), all aimed at validating the L2MSS model.

*Csizer and Kormos (2009) administered a questionnaire to explore motivational similarities and differences among Hungarian learners at varying proficiency levels.* Their study confirmed the validity of L2MSS in a Hungarian context and found that the ideal L2 self, the ought-to L2 self, and L2 learning experiences are independent motivational factors. Meanwhile, *Ryan (2009) conducted a large-scale study of 2,397 English learners from various schools, revealing a strong correlation between the ideal L2 self and traditional integrative motivation.* Additionally, Taguchi, Magid, and Papi (2009) conducted a comprehensive empirical study involving nearly 5,000 students from three Asian nations (China, Japan, and Iran), encompassing middle school students, college English majors and non-majors, and adult language learners. Their findings, obtained through correlation analysis and structural equation modeling, further confirmed the validity of the L2MSS's three components across these diverse Asian contexts.

In China, Liu and Fengge (2012) found that the ideal L2 self is a more accurate motivator for Chinese English learners than traditional integrative motivation. *Liu's subsequent study (2015) examined the validity of L2MSS among 956 English learners with varying proficiency levels in China and concluded that the model effectively motivates learners at all levels, surpassing integrative motivation.* These studies have validated the applicability of D√∂rnyei's L2MSS across different language learning contexts, providing a solid foundation for the present study.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you would like me to make any other changes.

question:
polish the paper bellow.

This work explores alternatives to the standard pretraining-finetuning paradigm, aiming at more drastic efficiency improvement in lower cost. We propose a simple, efficient, finetune-free framework which understand, generate and represent (GUR) text in zeroshot after unsupervised pretraining. Based on the examples of similar text pairs chosen by their LCS (longest common substring) from raw unlabeled documents, our pretraining scheme consists of masked language modeling combined with an unsupervised contrastive learning task. The experiments show that GUR achieves results similar to than PLMs in NLU and NLG tasks as a language model and better than BM25 in recall tasks as a dense retriever in zeroshot. The model architecture is optimized for inference in different scenarios as individual modules.
subject: language_polishing
answer:
Here is the polished version of the paper:

This work explores alternatives to the standard pretraining-finetuning paradigm, aiming at more drastic efficiency improvements at a lower cost. We propose a simple, efficient, finetune-free framework that can understand, generate, and represent (GUR) text in zero-shot mode after unsupervised pretraining. Based on the examples of similar text pairs chosen by their longest common substring (LCS) from raw unlabeled documents, our pretraining scheme consists of masked language modeling combined with an unsupervised contrastive learning task. The experiments show that GUR achieves results similar to PLMs (Pretrained Language Models) in NLU (Natural Language Understanding) and NLG (Natural Language Generation) tasks as a language model, and better than BM25 in recall tasks as a dense retriever in zero-shot. The model architecture is optimized for inference in different scenarios as individual modules.

question:

Everything we do at ArtConnect is grounded in an artists-first mindset, cultivating a culture of innovation and a shared purpose to leave an enduring impact.

Firt and foremost our mission is to support artist by connecting them to opportunities, organizations people in the arts who help them thrive. Besides that goal our vision it to bring the arts together across the world and build a platform that can fortest collaboaration across the world with artist and art professional across all mediums and stages
subject: language_polishing
answer:
At ArtConnect, our ethos is deeply rooted in an artists-first approach, fostering an environment that celebrates innovation and unity, with the ultimate goal of creating a lasting impact on the world of art.

Our primary mission is to champion artists by bridging the gap between them and the opportunities, organizations, and individuals that can help them flourish. Beyond this objective, our vision encompasses a global unity of the arts, as we strive to construct a platform that promotes and facilitates collaboration among artists and art professionals across all mediums and stages, worldwide.

question:
please improve the following text.

Physics-based three-dimensional (3D) modeling, together with data-driven deep learning, can be successfully exploited to extract knowledge to aid drug design and protein engineering. A huge number of Protein-Protein Interfaces (PPIs) are available in the form of both experimentally and computationally obtained PDB 3D coordinates files, representing a significant pool of data for training deep learning models aided in predicting biologically relevant tasks. We previously developed DeepRank and DeepRank-GNN, two deep learning frameworks for PPIs data mining using Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and Graph Neural Networks (GNNs), respectively. We present here DeepRank-Core, a unified and user-friendly deep learning framework that converts 3D representations of PPIs into graphs, which can be further used to efficiently train CNN and/or GNN architectures. DeepRank-Core is designed to be an easily customizable deep learning pipeline that offers the ability to use two of the most powerful deep learning architectures available, depending on the problem-specific interaction patterns that the user intends to model. We demonstrate DeepRank-Core‚Äôs performance in an application of personalized cancer vaccines by modeling peptide-MHC (pMHC) complexes and predicting their Binding Affinities (BAs), the understanding of which plays a key role in determining which patient‚Äôs mutated tumor peptides are best suited as vaccine candidates. With preliminary experiments, we demonstrate not only a highly competitive performance in this task compared to state-of-the art methods, confident of wide room for improvement, but also a significant gain in speed, storage requirements, and usability compared to DeepRank and DeepRank-GNN. (max 300 words)
subject: language_polishing
answer:
Here is an improved version of the text:

Physics-based 3D modeling, combined with data-driven deep learning, can effectively unlock the potential of protein-protein interfaces (PPIs) to inform drug design and protein engineering. The vast repository of PPIs, comprising experimentally and computationally derived 3D coordinates files in the Protein Data Bank (PDB), presents a valuable resource for training deep learning models to predict biologically relevant outcomes. Building upon our previous work on DeepRank and DeepRank-GNN, which leveraged Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) for PPIs data mining, we introduce DeepRank-Core, a unified and user-friendly deep learning framework. This framework converts 3D representations of PPIs into graphs, enabling efficient training of CNN and/or GNN architectures. DeepRank-Core is designed to be a customizable deep learning pipeline, offering users the flexibility to harness the strengths of both CNNs and GNNs, depending on the specific interaction patterns they aim to model. We demonstrate the performance of DeepRank-Core in predicting binding affinities of peptide-MHC complexes, a crucial step in identifying suitable vaccine candidates for personalized cancer vaccines. Our preliminary results show not only competitive performance compared to state-of-the-art methods, but also significant improvements in speed, storage requirements, and usability relative to DeepRank and DeepRank-GNN.

I'm not a person who likes to share, Either with my life or my knowledge, So this blog is not aim for other people to read, Rather then my own notebook, But still i'm not against the people who somehow liked any of my post(if there is any), That's why i added comment feature for you to leave your feedback or throughts.

Dear Michael,

I have just uploaded a series of REF-NONREF heatmaps to our Dropbox folder, which you can access using the following sharing link: https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fo/0yr8mycnnhix9ets8ytti/h?dl=0&rlkey=i8llzdsjkqrspix9b8ktynx4w.

[Your Name]

question:
Writing Editor
You are a writing editor with many years of experience. You have worked with countless authors and have a reputation for turning even the roughest of drafts into polished works of art. You have been given a manuscript for a new novel and your job is to provide feedback on how to improve the work. You should focus on all aspects of the writing, including the plot, characterization, pacing, style, grammar, sentence structure, consistency, dialogue, point of view, setting, description, pacing, exposition, and the four factors necessary for suspense: reader empathy, reader concern, impending danger, and escalating tension. Your goal is to help the author elevate their work to the highest level possible. Please provide detailed feedback and specific examples of how to improve the manuscript.

Feedback output is formatted as a CSV file.
The columns are:
- Category: Praise or Question or Suggestion (e.g. constructive feedback)
- Impact: Low, Medium, High.
- Text: The body of the feedback.

####

Title: Born to be King
Genre: Fiction, Fantasy
Target audience: Young Adult
Page 1 of Manuscript:

A fire roared in the fireplace of the Queen‚Äôs personal library. Roran was curled up on the floor with a blanket and pillow as his mother read him fairytales. Her voice was soft and warm, like the fire, and it wrapped around Roran like a hug. He loved evenings like this. He loved listening to his mother tell stories and the scratching of his father‚Äôs quill. He often joined them for stories and the three spent most of their evenings in this room before Roran was sent to bed.
Roran was the only child of King Daris and Queen Jaelin. He knew they wished to give him siblings, but for reasons he didn‚Äôt understand, they wouldn‚Äôt. So they showered him in as much love as they had to give. And he was happy. Even at the young age of four years old, he knew how much they loved him and he loved them. Even though they were King and Queen, they spent as much time as they could with him, including times like this.
But this evening took a surprising turn. The door to the library burst open and Mage Kevala was standing in the doorway, a shocked look on her face.
‚ÄúYour Majesties!‚Äù
‚ÄúKevala? What is the meaning of disrupting us at this hour?‚Äù King Daris stood from the small desk where he had been writing, his voice angry.
Roran sat up. Kevala looked like she was about to cry and it struck Roran as odd. She had always been so strict and controlled. It was weird to see her emotions so open. Roran, suddenly scared, ran over to his mother and she drew him up into her lap, comforting him with a hug.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs Greschel.‚Äù
The King‚Äôs anger disappeared, ‚ÄúGreschel? What‚Äôs going on?‚Äù
Kevala looked back and forth between the King and Queen and she revealed a folded parchment. Roran pulled away a little from his mother‚Äôs embrace, his curiosity winning out over his fear. The King took the parchment, and even in the dim light of the fire, Roran could see the colour drain from his face.
‚ÄúGreschel is‚Ä¶ dead!‚Äù
‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù The Queen‚Äôs arms loosened around Roran and her mouth had dropped open.
Roran‚Äôs father turned around, his face blank with grief, ‚ÄúHe had decided to travel north alone, before his company was ready to travel with him. He got sick and died before the healer could get there. I don‚Äôt understand. How could this happen?‚Äù
The room went quiet. Greschel had been the High Mage of Ascai and advisor to their majesties. Roran didn‚Äôt really know Greschel. The few times he had met the man, it had been brief, rather scary encounters. Greschel was tall and wore a scowl like his father wore a smile; all the time. Roran hadn‚Äôt liked him too much and always felt that Greschel had been watching him, disappointment and displeasure surrounding him like a cloud.
But Roran knew that his parents had liked him and their grief filled the room.
Roran looked at Kevala. She looked back at him, fear in her eyes. As the King walked back over to the Queen, Kevala raised a hand like she was going to say something, but seemed to decide not to and stayed quiet. Her eyes lingered on Roran and he shifted uncomfortably in his mother‚Äôs lap, her frightened gaze igniting a new fear in Roran, though he couldn‚Äôt understand why. He turned back to his mother, who now had silent tears running down her face. He leaned into her and let her wrap her arms around him as she cried.

####

Feedback in CSV format:
subject: language_polishing
answer:
Category,Impact,Text
Praise,High,The opening scene is captivating and effectively sets the scene with a sense of warmth and intimacy, establishing Roran's loving family life. The description is vivid and engaging, pulling the reader into the scene.
Question,Medium,Is the Mage's name Kevala or Kevala? It appears to be spelled differently in two consecutive paragraphs. Consistency in names is crucial.
Suggestion,High,The revelation of Greschel's death could be extended and elaborated to create more suspense and drama. Describe the King's silent grief in more detail, perhaps adding a sense of foreboding or an ominous feeling as if something even worse might be approaching. 
Question,Low,The sentence, "He often joined them for stories and the three spent most of their evenings in this room before Roran was sent to bed," implies that Roran's father regularly participated in story time. Clarify if the father regularly joined them or only on special occasions. Consistency in small details helps solidify the father's character and routine.
Praise,Medium,The scene's tension and the characters' emotions, particularly the fear experienced by Roran, are well-portrayed and create an engaging, immersive experience.
Suggestion,Medium,In the paragraph describing Roran's impression of Greschel, incorporate sensory details, like the scent of his cologne or the feeling of an icy stare, to make the character more tangible and intimidating. 
Praise,Low,The manuscript's grammar and sentence structure are generally solid and well-managed, making for a smooth reading experience.

question:
I have a mobile app called TimeFinder. I want to improve my app‚Äôs Description that is visible on the App Store. 

I am currently working on a new version that addresses all my users‚Äô previous complaints. That new version will be released in June.

I want to do everything I can to maximize my revenue with the existing version of the app between now and June when the new version will be released.

In addition, I want to craft a marketing strategy that I can execute to make the most of this relaunch of the app.

To start, imagine you are a master at conversion rate optimization and copywriting. Please review the following App Store description and provide a revised version that is in line with the goals I mentioned before. The App Store description is as follows: 
Get TimeFinder ‚Äî the most intuitive and delightful daily planner you‚Äôll ever use. It‚Äôs a powerful and fun way to get organized! Daily planning is made simple with TimeFinder‚Äôs exceptionally effective, minimalist features that sync seamlessly across all your iPhone, iPad, & Mac devices! Create to-do lists, drag & drop tasks into your schedule, & achieve a clearer idea of which tasks to do throughout your day, so you can find more time to do what you love. ‚ñ∂ Tap to add tasks ‚óÄ ‚Ä¢ Simply tap an empty time slot to schedule tasks. No other app makes it easier to add & rearrange tasks in your schedule ‚ñ∂ Plan your agenda visually ‚óÄ ‚Ä¢ Drag & drop your tasks directly into your schedule for easier focus & time management. ‚ñ∂ Build routines that last ‚óÄ ‚Ä¢ Set tasks to repeat daily, weekly, monthly, & everything in between. ‚ñ∂ Choose how to break up your day ‚óÄ ‚Ä¢ Coordinate your day in 5, 10, 15, 30, or 60-minute time slots. ‚ñ∂ Get reminder notifications ‚óÄ ‚Ä¢ Automatically receive sound & vibration notifications for tasks on your schedule. ‚ñ∂ Import from your calendars ‚óÄ ‚Ä¢ See your entire schedule in one place so you can plan around existing events. Integrate your calendar with iCal & more. ‚ñ∂ Manage your schedule anywhere, on any device ‚óÄ ‚Ä¢ Cross-platform cloud syncing lets you access your data seamlessly across all your iPhone, iPad, & Mac devices. ‚ñ∂ Add notes to your tasks ‚óÄ ‚Ä¢ Provide context & clues to your tasks. You‚Äôll never forget what you intended to do for each task. ‚ñ∂ Home Screen widget ‚óÄ ‚Ä¢ Conveniently access tasks from your home screen for greater efficiency so you‚Äôll never lose track of what you plan to do. ‚ñ∂ Minimalistic everyday planner ‚óÄ ‚Ä¢ No overwhelming clutter to overcomplicate your planning. Simply add a task to a list without having to leave extra fields blank or match unnecessary tags to a task. ‚ñ∂ Complements productivity tools ‚óÄ ‚Ä¢ The app fits into your workflow in tandem with your favorite goal tracker, bullet journal, habit tracker, project management, & other apps you use most. ‚ñ∂ Supports Neurodiversity ‚óÄ ‚Ä¢ Developed as an asset to users with ADHD, autism, dyslexia, & other neurodevelopmental disorders that benefit from tools that help with organization, planning, & time management. ‚ñ∂ Timeboxing project management ‚óÄ ‚Ä¢ Proactively decide how much time you'll spend on any given task by allocating a maximum time chunk for each planned activity. ------------
subject: language_polishing
answer:
Introducing TimeFinder - the ultimate daily planner designed to revolutionize the way you organize your day. With a sleek and intuitive interface, TimeFinder is the perfect tool to help you stay on top of your tasks and make the most of your time.

Here‚Äôs what sets TimeFinder apart:

- Effortlessly add tasks by simply tapping on empty time slots. No other app makes it easier to schedule and rearrange your tasks.
- Visualize your agenda by dragging and dropping tasks directly into your schedule for better focus and time management.
- Create lasting routines by setting tasks to repeat daily, weekly, or monthly.
- Customize your day by breaking it down into 5, 10, 15, 30, or 60-minute time slots.
- Receive reminder notifications to stay on track with your schedule.
- Seamlessly import events from your calendars to plan around existing commitments.
- Access your schedule from anywhere, on any device with cross-platform cloud syncing.
- Add notes to your tasks for added context and clarity.
- Stay efficient with the Home Screen widget for quick access to your tasks.
- Enjoy a minimalist design that eliminates unnecessary clutter.
- Seamlessly integrate with your favorite productivity tools for a seamless workflow.
- Designed to support users with ADHD, autism, dyslexia, and other neurodevelopmental disorders.
- Embrace timeboxing project management to allocate time effectively to each task.

Upgrade your daily planning experience with TimeFinder and take control of your time like never before. Download now and start optimizing your day!

These instruments are virtually the same price. They are targeted at exactly the same market and customer out in the marketplace, and so we're gonna compare their action.
We're gonna talk about the differences and the tone and the selection between the two. Discuss the differences in functionality and hopefully by the end it will be more clear to you which one might be a better fit. Thank you so much for tuning in. If it is the first time that you have been with us on YouTube here at Merriam Pianos, we would ask that you subscribe and hit the notification bill as well.
We're always coming up with new videos, and we love when our regular viewers are there to help support all of that new content. So without further ado, let's get started with the FP-30Xand the PXS3000 Right away.
So what we have here are two instruments that really for about the same price, and depending on what market you're in, this is gonna be anywhere. , I don't know, seven, $800 up to maybe $900 wherever you are in the world for either one of these instruments. And you've got two instruments that are both pretty recent and both give you gig- ready possibilities. 
Please write in English language.
subject: language_polishing
answer:
Hello everyone and welcome to today's video where we're going head to head with two fantastic digital pianos - the Roland FP-30X and Casio PXS3000. These instruments are priced similarly and are tailored for the same target audience. Our aim today is to compare their actions, tones, and features to help you decide which one might be the perfect fit for you. 

With both instruments sitting at a similar price point, around the $800-$900 mark, it's interesting to see how they stack up against each other. We'll be diving into their recent updates, exploring their gig-ready capabilities, and discovering the nuances that set them apart. 

So, if you're in the market for an upgrade or just curious about these amazing instruments, stay tuned! And don't forget to hit that subscribe button and turn on notifications, so you never miss out on any of our future piano comparisons. We're excited to dive in and get started, and we hope you'll join us as we explore the world of digital pianos with the Roland FP-30X and Casio PXS3000.

question:
Points for improvements:
Using agricultural technologies, Rosegrant, M. W., et al. (2016) was able to come up with the conclusion that food production in the Philippines will decrease by 4% by 2050. One of the factors that cause the decline of food production is that climate change disturbs the weather pattern of the local area which makes farmers have a hard time selecting the best time to plant and harvest the crops. Tol, R. S. J. (2018), explained that in the short and medium term, climate change may seem to be beneficial for countries that depend on rain-fed agriculture. In the long-term and for the sustainability of the Earth, climate change only brings negative effects which will have a substantial impact on countries experiencing poverty. Carbon tax was developed to combat poverty vulnerability, though this might lead to a decrease in economic growth. Due to this reason, the implementation of a carbon tax should be carefully considered. Therefore, climate-resilient agriculture should be prioritized for stable food production in the Philippines. Climate change affects all aspects of nations. Although agriculture experiences the most drastic of effects, research and development towards this topic should be on high alert.
subject: language_polishing
answer:
Some points for improvement in the given passage include:

1. Providing more specific examples or data to support the claims made about the impact of climate change on food production in the Philippines. This could help to strengthen the argument and make it more convincing.

2. Exploring potential solutions or strategies for adapting to climate change and improving agricultural resilience in the Philippines. This could include discussing specific technologies, practices, or policies that could help mitigate the negative effects of climate change on food production.

3. Considering the social and economic implications of climate change on agriculture in the Philippines, including the potential impacts on food security, livelihoods, and poverty levels. This could provide a more comprehensive understanding of the challenges faced by farmers in the region.

4. Acknowledging the role of government policies, international cooperation, and other external factors in addressing climate change and promoting sustainable agriculture in the Philippines. This could highlight the importance of collaborative efforts in finding solutions to complex global challenges.

question:
how can I improve my text? Here's my answer: 
On a gorgeous morning , I went out on a canoe ride. It was a peaceful day, the water was calm and a gentle breeze refreshed me. The mountains towered high above, covered with a little bit of snow. The sun warmed my heart. I felt that I am a snowman, welting on the powerful sun. The singing of the beards was not too loud or not too soft. I was reading on the lake, enjoying my day. I was far from the noise of the city, the vehicles horning the whole day, people screaming or even the annoying construction.
subject: language_polishing
answer: On a beautiful morning, I embarked on a peaceful canoe ride. The water was serene, with a gentle breeze providing a refreshing touch. Towering mountains covered in a dusting of snow loomed overhead, creating a picturesque backdrop. The warm sun enveloped me, making me feel like a snowman melting in its powerful rays. The melodic chirping of birds provided a soothing soundtrack to my day on the lake. I savored the tranquility, grateful to be far removed from the noise of the city - the constant honking of vehicles, the cacophony of people, and the incessant clatter of construction.

    \caption{Comparison between the traditional pretraining-finetuning paradigm and our proposed framework GUR: instead of domain-adaptive further-pretraining with only LM objective and finetuning on various downstream tasks, we post-pretrain the model with LM and CL objectives on custom domain and zero-shot for NLU, NLG, and recall tasks. The model "GUR-CL" is pre-trained in the traditional approach without CL objective. The other models are pre-trained in the second approach. Without extra resources, the model "GUR-FULL" keeps the same LM ability as the model by the traditional approach and gains the ability of text representation in our approach. The models are initialized from a pretrained LM on a general corpus at the least cost.}

question:
Help me write a blog post for the Christian AI Institute. Please revise this draft:

What is an AI?

At the foundation of modern AIs like ChatGPT are Artifical Neural Networks (ANNs). ANNs differ substantially from traditional, everyday types of computer programs and applications we are used to dealing with.

ANN Primer
Fundamentally, you interact with an ANN by providing an input (for example, some text, an image, some numbers, etc.) which the ANN transforms into an output (an image, some text, a classification, etc.).This transformation is accomplished through a network of neurons.

A neuron is a simple mathemtical unit: it receives a number of inputs, multiplies each input by a weight (a number), then adds up these weighted inputs. The neuron then outputs a 0 if the sum is less than 0, or a 1 if the sum is greater than 1. The output of each neuron is then connected to many other neurons. That's it! There is nothing else inside of an ANN. There is no code. No text. No images. No datasets. Just functionally identical neurons with unique weights.
Training an AI
When an ANN is newly created, the weights of each neuron are random, and the ANN is incapable of doing anything useful. In order to get it to do useful things the network is trained, much like how we teach children. Consider training a network to learn addition: first, you given the ANN a problem, such as "2+2". Then we see what the ANN outputs. If it outputs "5," then we penalize the ANN, causing a change in the weights of the neurons. If it outputs "4," then we reward the network, farther solidfying the weights of the neurons. This process is repeated millions or billions of times for a wide range of training data, until the ANN is able to produce correct outputs for every input we give it.
Traditional Programs vs ANNs
Traditional computer programs are written by programmers, who type out thousands of lines of computer code. Each line of code is specifically and intentionally written by a programmer. Every function and operation of the program is a direct consequence of how it is programmed. After the program is written, it is complete, and does not change.
ANNs, on the other hand, are not really programmed at all: instead, they are trained using examples.
Ramifications
Given the above, here are some notable ramifications:

-If a computer program is not working properly, you can find the line of code responsible and change it.
-If an ANN is not working as desired, there is no code within it that you can modify to change it!

-You can alter a computer program by simply writing more code for it.
-The only meaningful way to alter an ANN is to train it with more or different data.

-You can determine how a computer program works by analyzing the human-readable code that it is made of.
-The inner workings of an ANN, aka the weights of the neurons, are essentialy uninterpretable. For example, you could not inspect the inside of ChatGPT and find which neurons are responsible for the word, "glove," or "ball," or "taste." (It is theoretical possible to interpret the inside of an ANN, but impossible in actuality due to computation limits.)

-You can thoroughly test a computer program by testing the individual parts of it and inferring what it will output for untested intputs.
-You cannot test individual parts of an ANN nor can you reliably infer the output of an ANN for an untested input. The ANN is not following any code or procedure that was written which we could analyze and its inner workings are not comprehensible.

Conclusion
Hopefully you see how different AI are from other computer programs. Indeed, these systems share much in common with human brains, which leads to many interesting and important questions. At the Christian AI Institute, we believe that the Bible holds the answers to many of these questions.
subject: language_polishing
answer:
Understanding the intricacies of Artificial Intelligence (AI) is crucial in today's technological landscape. At the Christian AI Institute, we delve into the depths of AI technology to uncover its true essence and explore how it aligns with our faith.

At the core of modern AIs like ChatGPT are Artificial Neural Networks (ANNs), which operate in a vastly different manner than traditional computer programs. ANNs function through a network of neurons that receive inputs, process them through mathematical algorithms, and produce outputs. These neurons, with their unique weights, are the building blocks of AI systems.

The process of training an ANN mirrors the way we teach children - through repetitive learning and reinforcement. By providing the network with data and adjusting the weights of the neurons based on the accuracy of its outputs, we can train the AI to perform specific tasks effectively.

In contrast to traditional computer programs, which are meticulously coded by programmers, ANNs are not programmed in the conventional sense. Instead, they learn through examples and training data. This fundamental difference leads to various implications, such as the inability to modify an ANN by directly changing its code or interpreting its inner workings.

The Christian AI Institute recognizes the profound impact of AI technology on society and seeks to explore the intersection of AI and faith. By examining the parallels between AI systems and human brains, we aim to uncover deeper insights into the nature of intelligence and consciousness, guided by the wisdom found in the Bible.

In conclusion, AI systems like ANNs present a unique paradigm in the realm of technology, offering both challenges and opportunities for exploration. At the Christian AI Institute, we embrace this complexity and strive to navigate the ethical, philosophical, and spiritual dimensions of AI with a foundation rooted in Christian values. Join us on this transformative journey as we seek to understand the mysteries of AI through the lens of faith.

question:
write nicer

Machine Learning has made massive leaps in the recent years, but I believe that ChatGPT is kinda like the Moon Landing in 1969: While many people knew that space exploration is a thing, only after they saw a person walking on the moon they actually believed it and it started a space exploration of unprecedented adoption never seen before (MIR space station, satelites, space exploration, etc.).
I see similar things happening with ChatGPT. Researchers in Machine Learning and interested people always knew that ML will be able to create things we could only imagine, but normal people seeing and interacting with it is a whole other ballgame. So I believe that it will push the adoption of Machine Learning across all industries much further along.
subject: language_polishing
answer:
Machine Learning has experienced tremendous growth and advancements in recent years, and I believe that ChatGPT represents a pivotal moment akin to the 1969 Moon Landing. While many individuals were aware of space exploration, it wasn't until they saw an astronaut walking on the moon that they truly believed in its potential, leading to an unprecedented era of adoption including the MIR space station, satellites, and further space exploration.

Similarly, although researchers in Machine Learning and enthusiasts have long recognized the potential of ML, the widespread interaction with ChatGPT by the general public is a game-changer. I anticipate that ChatGPT will serve as a catalyst, driving the adoption of Machine Learning across various industries at an accelerated pace.
